quote: There are two insults no human being will endure: that he has no sense of humor, and that he has never known trouble.

quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.

quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

quote: The mark of a true crush... is that you fall in love first and grope for reasons afterward.

author: Jean Cocteau

author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: Libraries were full of ideas–perhaps the most dangerous and powerful of all weapons.

author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.
author: Ernest Hemingway

author: Sydney Smith

quote: The comfortable estate of widowhood is the only hope that keeps up a wife's spirits.

quote: Humor is an affirmation of dignity, a declaration of man's superiority to all that befalls him.
author: Romain Gary

author: Martin Luther

quote: The past explains how I got here, but the future is up to me - and I love to live life at full throttle.
author: Janice Dickinson

quote: Treat a work of art like a prince. Let it speak to you first.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: It happens to everyone as they grow up. You find out who you are and what you want, and then you realize that people you've known forever don't see things the way you do. So you keep the wonderful memories, but find yourself moving on.

quote: Say 'provoking' again. Your mouth looks provocative when you do.
author: Becca Fitzpatrick

quote: Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this.
author: Dave Eggers

quote: I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read.
author: Nicholson Baker

author: Ray Bradbury

author: Frank Herbert

quote: Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination.
author: Mark Twain

author: Leonardo da Vinci

author: William Shakespeare

author: Arthur Erickson

author: Blake Shelton

quote: I hope that tomorrow we can all, wherever we are, join in expressing our grief at Diana's loss, and gratitude for her all-too-short life. It is a chance to show to the whole world the British nation united in grief and respect.

author: Rumi

author: Sarah Dessen

author: Dr. Seuss

author: Oscar Wilde

author: Sarah McLachlan

source: The World As I See It

author: Tom Robbins

quote: Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful.

author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: I think... if it is true that there are as many minds as there are heads, then there are as many kinds of love as there are hearts.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
author: Albert Einstein

author: Al Green

author: Samuel Johnson

author: David Rakoff

quote: My daughter doesn't even get my humor. She's like, 'Um, no. I don't get it, Dad. Mmm, no, not that one, Dad.'

author: Tommy Lasorda

quote: Great artists suffer for the people.
author: Marvin Gaye

quote: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Time is Too Slow for those who Wait, Too Swift for those who Fear, Too Long for those who Grieve, Too Short for those who Rejoice; But for those who Love, Time is not.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything is ready, we shall never begin.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: What Is Love? I have met in the streets a very poor young man who was in love. His hat was old, his coat worn, the water passed through his shoes and the stars through his soul
author: Victor Hugo

quote: There's plenty of sense in nonsense sometimes, if you wish to look for it.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: A lot of people don't have near the amount of success as I've been blessed to have, and it's all about working hard and hoping that continues.
author: Luke Bryan

quote: One friend in a lifetime is much; two are many; three are hardly possible. Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life, a community of thought, a rivalry of aim.
author: Brooks Adams

quote: What is true of the individual will be tomorrow true of the whole nation if individuals will but refuse to lose heart and hope.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: As far as humor goes, I've always been a very insecure person and I've always wanted to be liked.
author: Peter Steele

quote: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
author: Plato

Or if your girlfriend asks you if the sweater she is wearing makes her look fat; you're going to lie because you love that person. There are different reasons and justifications to lie; it's human nature.
author: Monica Raymund

quote: I will preach with my brush.
author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

quote: Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be.
author: Orson Scott Card

quote: Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!
author: J.K. Rowling
source: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

quote: It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal.
author: E.M. Forster

quote: An intellectual says a simple thing in a hard way. An artist says a hard thing in a simple way.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Don't Panic.
author: Douglas Adams
source: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

quote: Poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: To see a World in a Grain of Sand And a Heaven in a Wild Flower, Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand And Eternity in an hour.
author: William Blake

quote: Don't take life too seriously. Punch it in the face when it needs a good hit. Laugh at it.
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: If loving someone is putting them in a straitjacket and kicking them down a flight of stairs, then yes, I have loved a few people.

quote: If loving someone is putting them in a straitjacket and kicking them down a flight of stairs, then yes, I have loved a few people.
author: Jarod Kintz

quote: Nothing is as seductive as the assurance of success.

author: Bill Cosby

author: Stacey D'Erasmo

quote: If I didn't try to eavesdrop on every bus ride I take or look for the humor when I go for a walk, I would just be depressed all the time.
author: Lynda Barry

quote: There are two means of refuge from the miseries of life: music and cats.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: I would love to close my eyes and see myself with my girlfriend when we're 99 years old and I have a pipe and she's knitting a sweater, and I hope that's the way it goes. I think it's a challenge every day.
author: Chris Messina

quote: I decided on the spot that I would be an artist, and I assure you, it was no ordinary artist I had in mind.
author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

quote: You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?
author: Suzanne Collins

quote: When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: If you don't like someone's story, write your own.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Some old wounds never truly heal, and bleed again at the slightest word.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.
author: Christopher Paolini

quote: When I sit here and see that the eight brothers from the neighborhood that I grew up with still have success, it had to be magical. I doubt if you get another 'Wu-Tang Clan.' That might be harder than getting the new 'Jackson Five.' Certain groups you only get one time, and we just happened to be that group.
author: Raekwon

quote: To hope means to be ready at every moment for that which is not yet born, and yet not become desperate if there is no birth in our lifetime.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: It's quite difficult to write about female friendship without it seeming to be a very niche subject. It's a difficult balance.
author: Samantha Harvey

quote: My dad was very much a John Wayne kind of guy, but he was also a great guy, great sense of humor, a real dedicated dad. I don't think he ever missed a hockey game I was in.
author: Denis Leary

quote: I think we all suffer from acute blindness at times. Life is a constant journey of trying to open your eyes. I'm just beginning my journey, and my eyes aren't fully open yet.
author: Olivia Thirlby

quote: To live in this world, you must be able to do three things: to love what is mortal; to hold it against your bones knowing your own life depends on it; and, when the time comes to let it go, to let it go.

quote: To an engineer, good enough means perfect. With an artist, there's no such thing as perfect.
author: Alexander Calder

quote: Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.

quote: I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between.

source: The Unabridged Journals of Sylvia Plath

quote: The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: If a man has been his mother's undisputed darling he retains throughout life the triumphant feeling, the confidence in success, which not seldom brings actual success along with it.
author: Sigmund Freud

author: Najib Mikati

quote: Humor is very very risky, particularly for a candidate, unless he's been in so long that it just doesn't matter, and he's not running for president. But it's just that people are so sensitive and so touchy, and you're just going to upset somebody without ever realizing it.

quote: Love is our true destiny. We do not find the meaning of life by ourselves alone - we find it with another.
